title: JavaScript Best Practices

content.html:
JavaScript Best Practices

Writing clean, maintainable JavaScript code is crucial for long-term success. Here are some key best practices:

1. Use Descriptive Variable Names

Choose variable names that clearly describe what the variable contains or represents.

2. Keep Functions Small and Focused

Each function should do one thing well. This makes your code easier to test and debug.

3. Use Comments Wisely

Write comments that explain why you're doing something, not what you're doing.

4. Avoid Global Variables

Minimize the use of global variables to prevent naming conflicts and make your code more predictable.

description: Learn essential best practices for writing clean, maintainable JavaScript code.
